title: About Roster Plugin
synopsis: This plugin provides a hoverable, clickable roster of sites participating in a group activity. [https://github.com/fedwiki/wiki-plugin-roster github]

title: Changes to this Site
synopsis: Below we list recent changes to this site only without also listing changes from the [[Neighbourhood]]:

title: Cinema of the Future
synopsis: How can we still talk about writing a traditional script when our writing today, everyday writing, in social media includes video links, photos, other people's comments, likes, etc.?

title: Common People
synopsis: Here we write about the [[Common People]], that is people who have in one way or other substantially added to the [[commons]], or are writing here together.

title: Commons
synopsis: The commons is the cultural and natural resources accessible to all members of a society, including natural materials such as air, water, and a habitable earth. These resources are held in common, not owned privately - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commons wikipedia]

title: Commons Reading List
synopsis: Here we list some reading related to concept and theory of [[the commons]]. Tick each article off as you read them. You may wish to add to this list here (on your forked copy), or over at Wikipedia - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commons#References wikipedia]

title: Constraint Based Layout
synopsis: We can constrain the layout of a graph in any number of ways. Adding these constraints, is the basis of much logic, and our ability to reason from the data. In a looser sense it is also the basis with which we can seek patterns, abstractions and simplifications of complex interactions.

title: Currently Working On
synopsis: Here is a list of [[Recent Changes]] I consider important. View our experiments on the [[Scratch]] page. To clear stuff saved in your browser try [[Local Changes]].

title: Data Quality
synopsis: The [[Data Quality]] and [[Qualities of Data]] you gather are the foundation of [[the commons]].

title: David Bovill
synopsis: On this site I write and research about [[the commons]], the projects I am working on and the courses I am teaching. In particular I write about the [[Projects in Bilbao]] that I am familiar with and look to support.

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content:

title: Garden Patterns Inventory
synopsis: We duplicate an illustration from Timeless Way of Building using Graph plugins and our graph building workflow.

title: Growing Graphs From Wiki
synopsis: Here Conventional [[Big Data]] analysis starts with a large amount of easily harvested data, and seeks patterns within the networks of connections generated. Here we look to see how we can proceed from the ground up.

title: Half-Hidden Garden
synopsis: If a garden is too close to the street, people won't use it because it isn't private enough. But if it is too far from the street, then it won't be used either, because it is too isolated.

title: How We Find Data
synopsis: Pages from many sites can find each other when they arrive together in a browser and at that moment connect  data to computations and computations to visualizations. Here we explain how that happens.

title: Human Ecosystems
synopsis: Human Ecosystems is a family of real-time system capturing information from social networks to visualise the human geography of cities, across space, time and relations - [http://human-ecosystems.com/home/about-the-human-ecosystems/ human-ecosystems.com]

title: Installing Human Ecosystems
synopsis: Installing instructions - [https://github.com/xdxdVSxdxd/HumanEcosystems/blob/master/HE_v2/installation-instructions.txt github]

title: Lineup Viewer
synopsis: Here we merge graphs from the lineup into a single graph rendered with Cytoscape. Loading takes a few seconds.

title: Linked Data
synopsis: In computing, linked data (often capitalized as Linked Data) describes a method of publishing structured data so that it can be interlinked and become more useful through semantic queries - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linked_data wikipedia]

title: Mots Voisins
synopsis: Words have neighbours. Cousins. Fathers. Children. In wiki, and before that in the long [[History Of Hypertext]], we are exploring how to materialise these connections between words.

title: OSCEdays
synopsis: A global event exploring the [[Open Source]] and the [[Circular Economy]] - [https://oscedays.org/ oscedays.org]

title: OSCEDays Writers
synopsis: Here we collect a small group of people to write together for [[OSCEDays]].

title: Plantoid
synopsis: A prototype for the European Space Agency is now in development - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plantoid wikipedia]

title: Qualities of Data
synopsis: Data can be seen as an attempt to define sources over which we can agree. In this sense it is deliberately crafted as a neutral resource, though it can contain many hidden biases.

title: Running Into Runes
synopsis: Here's a first generalistic jam about the principle of the [[Korus]]. I'll try to translate it fully in english and espa√±ol, Rosetta stone style. Then work on at least 5 different modules ;-)

title: Salvatore Iaconesi
synopsis: Salvatore is a designer, robotics engineer, artist, hacker and principal and co-founder of Art is Open Source.

title: Singing With Plants
synopsis: In this project we look to research, document and write together on a project to examine [[How Plants Communicate]].

title: The Commons
synopsis: The commons is the cultural and natural resources accessible to all members of a society, including natural materials such as air, water, and a habitable earth. These resources are held in common, not owned privately - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commons wikipedia]

title: Ward Cunningham
synopsis: I'm enjoying reading more in the federation. Here is a place that I can fork content without concern for the information architecture that results.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: As part of [[OSCEDays]] we look to write and research together on topics related to creating sustainable commons, whether biological, social or digital in and around the area of [[Blibao]].
